description.narrative: Mercy Corps is partnering with the water utility to increase access to treated municipal water for vulnerable and poor areas through the rehabilitation of 23 km of the water network and construction of a 700 cubic meter reservoir. In addition, Mercy Corps works closely and mentors water-user committees, provides technology and training for rainwater harvesting, and promotes safe water usage. To improve sanitation knowledge and behavior, Mercy Corps is implementing public awareness campaigns, school-based outreach, and community health workers training. The program is improving sanitation-related infrastructure through construction of latrines and water catchment systems for schools, health centers, and other community sites.

Through the Food Security for Goma program, Mercy Corps is strengthening food security in 14 urban and peri-urban communities in North Kivu through improved water and sanitation and hygiene education. This program is addressing the root causes of vulnerability in the target areas through substantially reducing the incidence of waterborne diseases, thereby improving the nutritional status of 84,500 vulnerable individuals. The Food Security for Goma program targets some of the most troubled areas in and around the provincial capital of Goma. The program works with communities on improving access, availability and utilization to water and sanitation infrastructure.
